name: TheAtlantic
text: That the president’s reprieve for his friend Roger Stone was predictable makes it no less brazen, writes @RussellBerman: https://t.co/5knlh9NKFG

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @IsaacDovere: Trump’s Roger Stone commutation was so completely predictable that @russellberman has this story ready to go when it happened. 

Yet as he writes: “the seeming inevitability of Trump’s decision made it no less brazen.” https://t.co/gUtcGt068s

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @russellberman: Long before the Ukraine affair, Trump's potential pardon of an alleged co-conspirator was the precise example Jerry Nadler, not yet House Judiciary chairman, gave of a clearly impeachable offense. https://t.co/62gonfj4ly

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: "Trump stepped in to save a man convicted of lying to Congress ... The one check Congress has on that particular power is the move it has already unsuccessfully deployed." Really smart @russellberman: https://t.co/p2O1q1TcH8

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JohnGHendy: “Tonight, Trump stepped in to save a man convicted of lying to Congress in order to protect the president.” @russellberman on Roger Stone https://t.co/dBvqosH7Xa

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @PeterAtlantic: That the president’s reprieve for his friend Roger Stone was predictable makes it no less brazen, writes @RussellBerman: https://t.co/ZG7ZI8cBxN
